markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 20"
    pfs=""
>
[Protective Spirit Mask](/Feats.aspx?ID=3436) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients](/Sources.aspx?ID=115) pg. 78</row>

**Archetypes** [Druid](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=6), [Wizard](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=12) (Level 20)

**Prerequisites**
[Druid Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=701) or [Wizard Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=742)

</column>

---

Your mask carries the protective instincts of White Bull, the Horn Forger, and no one will hurt your allies while you have anything to say about it. Immediately after you Cast a non-cantrip Spell that targets only one ally, you can choose to have the spell also give that creature a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn. You also gain the Protector's Interdiction reaction.

**Protector's Interdiction** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** An adjacent ally is hit or critically hit by an attack; **Effect** You interpose yourself between your ally and the attack. The attack hits you instead, or critically hits you if it critically hit your ally.

<title level="2">Masks of the Magic Warriors</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients](/Sources.aspx?ID=115) pg. 78</row>

In becoming Jatembe's new Magic Warriors, the heroes have unlocked secrets of magical potential that none have reached since the earliest Ten Magic Warriors walked the plazas of the Magaambya.

 On reaching 20th level, the heroes should have the option of taking one of these archetype feats, based on the type of animal they chose for their mask when they first created it in _Pathfinder Adventure Path #169: Kindled Magic_. These options are each themed to one of Jatembe's magic warriors, but if a hero's mask doesn't fit with a specific animal from this list or the player feels their animal embodies a different effect from the list, feel free to reflavor the feat names to fit the hero's spirit face. For instance, the Cunning Trickster mask could easily be a rodent or a fox, not just a spider.

**Related Feats**: [Cunning Trickster Mask](/Feats.aspx?ID=3433), [Emancipator's Mask](/Feats.aspx?ID=3434), [Grand Medic's Mask](/Feats.aspx?ID=3435), [Sky Master Mask](/Feats.aspx?ID=3437), [Stalking Feline Mask](/Feats.aspx?ID=3438), [Storyteller's Mask](/Feats.aspx?ID=3439), [Thick Hide Mask](/Feats.aspx?ID=3440), [Tireless Guide's Mask](/Feats.aspx?ID=3441), [Vigilant Mask](/Feats.aspx?ID=3442)
name: Protective Spirit Mask
